metadata.title: CVE-2021-3520 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
There's a flaw in lz4. An attacker who submits a crafted file to anapplication linked with lz4 may be able to trigger an integer overflow,leading to calling of memmove() on a negative size argument, causing anout-of-bounds write and/or a crash. The greatest impact of this flaw is toavailability, with some potential impact to confidentiality and integrityas well.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3520` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

liblz4-1 - 1.9.3-2
liblz4-tool - 1.9.3-2
lz4 - 1.9.3-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lz4 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.9.3-2').
